title: multiple signature texts
content:
It makes sense that you might want your signature text to change depending on who you are communicating with (employer, business, friend, etc).

In Outlook you can enter several signature texts, identified by a name. I sure would like to have that in Thunderbird!

Another possibility would be to circulate among several signature texts, just to "keep it fresh".

Thanks for your consideration.

title: Multiple Spam recceive eac time Thunderbird starts with exactly the same time stamp
content:
Each time I start Thunderbird I get 200+ spam messages all slightly different but similar pattern (meaning that each day this can be a total of more than 1,000 spam). 

I can get 50% of them deleted via filters but there is often random data in the address that prevent them all being captured.

I wonder if my copy of Thunderbird has been compromised or the Thunderbird server has been compromised. It doesn't appear to be from our email hosting service as we changed the company and still get them. I have checked for malware many times with no infection reported.

This problem has continued for several months. Please help if you can.

Thank you
creator: perfumer

title: openssl signed messages show verification error 1041
content:
Hallo,

in an effort to understand why one s/mime signed message I received could not be verified by Thunderbird (140.3.0esr (64-bit) on Ubuntu 24.04.3 LTS) (error 1041, "unknown problems with this digital signature"), but by all other clients I and others could check (including cli tools openssl, cmsutil), I did a few tests using my own certificate (using rsaEncryption, SHA256).

Inital observation: Messages signed with "openssl smime -sign -in msg.txt -to <email> -from <my-email> -subject test -signer mycert.pem -inkey mykey.pem -out signed.eml" and opened in Thunderbird showed error 1041. Any modifiers like -crlfeol, -text, -binary, ... did not make a difference.

Omitting signed attributes (-noattr) however helped. The signature was verified.

Looking at the signed attributes, nothing seems wrong: hash in messageDigest is correct, sha256 and rsaEncryption is given. Checking more carefully the signature, the hash of the attribute section is also correct. Manually verifying the DER attribute section with the given signature is also fine.

The question is, what is the reason that Thunderbird rejects the signature? I didn't manage to produce a log output of the verification, so this general error 1041 is all I have. Is Thunderbird more strict as openssl? And if so, at what point?

The only point I see where there could be a problem in handling the attributes is the header of the DER attribute section. In the full signature this starts with 0xa0, as stand-alone block it should be 0x31 - only then the hash matches. However, that's wild guessing.

Any ideas? Already some info on how to access a log output on the verification would help.
creator: EinPhysiker

title: Mbox and Anti Virus
content:
Hi Folks,

I want to seek opinion on how to manage the virus detected in emails (or its attachments) through Kaspersky Anti Virus.

I have large no of emails in TB stored in mbox format. Around 30GB in Inbox and another 5GB in Sent, etc. I also use Kaspersky Internet Security which has anti-virus also active.

Now my anti virus detects some infected emails. How to clean the infected virus emails / attachments.

Question: 1) When using mbox file on TB, is Kaspersky capable to delete ONLY a single specific infected file from the entire mbox data without any corruption of mail data? 2) If not, how to setup the anti-virus to automatically clean, disinfect and delete/quanrantine individual mail. ?

3) Is MailDir a better way to save emails in profile and use anti-virus. There is a warning on Maildir saying its still not settled and may have bugs. Is that true even today ?

Thanks & Regards, Tejas

title: Outgoing server problem
content: Can anyone please help me? I use Thunderbird email and for several weeks now I have been able to receive emails but not to send them. At first outgoing messages were refused with the messages "rejected by outgoing server." The outgoing server is PlusNet. I sought help from PlusNet and after several days they told me the problem was connected with their migrating email business to a third party, but was now solved. For a few hours I was able to send messages, soon reverted to the situation where incoming messages are received but outgoing messages are rejected. This time the rejection messages say "rejected due to internal server error." But surely, PlusNet IS the outgoing server? I give up. and PlusNet is hard to contact, they don't seem to accept emails anyway. So can any other TB user advise me, and am I the only one with this problem? PeterB

title: TB not showing all local folders after new TB installation on Win 11 and migration of profile from old Win 10 computer
content:
I used TB for many years on several computers. Last week, I had to reinstall TB on a Win 11 computer, and tried to migrate my TB profile from the Win 10 computer. However, this is an ongoing problem. After several attempts, I have a TB profile on the Win 11 computer that seems to look OK. However, when I open TB, not all the local folders appear in the TB Local folders menu. I read several discussions and guides from other TB users, and tried the suggested fixes. They did not solve the problem. The Local Folders exist in the profile in the Mail folder. When I open the Local Folders, I can see all my local folders that were copied from the TB profile on the Win 10 computers. These include .mozmsgs and .sbd folders. When scrolling down in the Local Folders, after the .mozmsgs and .sbd folders, I can see pairs of folder names w/o extensions (the open with notepad and contain text) and files with the same names but with .msf extensions.

So, theoretically, all the local folders should show up when opening TB. But they don't.

At this stage, I don't know what to do, and I would appreciate your help.

Thank you.

Ted
creator: tedk
